title: Just In Time For President's Day, Students Have A Message For Donald Trump
text:
02/20/2017 09:37 am ET Just In Time For President's Day, Students Have A Message For Donald Trump “People deserve to be together. I know I can’t make you change your mind, but a president is supposed to care for his country," one student wrote. By Savannah OLeary 
On the day President Donald Trump was elected, Laura Jones ― a fourth-grade teacher at a predominantly Latino and Hispanic public school in Houston ― found herself facing questions she did not know how to answer. 
“Ms. Jones, am I going to become an orphan?” “Is my family going to be separated?” “Why doesn’t Donald Trump like us?” her students asked. 
Jones told them to put their thoughts into writing in letters addressed to the newly elected president. Their responses were stunning, heart-wrenching and cautiously hopeful. Jacqueline Harriet This 9-year-old student signed his letter, "I'm proud to say I'm black." 
“ I would like to know, how do you know all this about Mexicans?” asked 9-year-old Leans Dican. “These people are coming for a better life, for food and for a better future for their family. They come here to work in the best country in the world.” 
Some students were too afraid to even sign their names, for fear of putting their families at risk. Jacqueline Harriet "I hope you get my letter and change your mind," wrote 9-year-old Leans Dican Close SUBSCRIBE TO & FOLLOW TRUMP'S FIRST 100 DAYS
